<item>
<title>Melbourne City beats Sydney FC in W-League grand final to claim third consecutive title</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-18/melbourne-city-beats-sydney-fc-in-w-league-grand-final/9459766</link>

<item>
<title>Driver on mobile phone for 20 seconds before hitting two police at RBT, court hears</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-17/driver-charged-over-hitting-police-at-rbt/9457526</link>

<item>
<title>NDIS transition could see children with severe disabilities withdrawn from out-of-home care</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-17/ndis-transition-children-disabilities-withdrawn-out-of-home-care/9456650</link>
<description>Parents of children with severe disabilities in NSW are "terrified" they could lose access to around-the-clock care due to a funding stoush between the State Government and the NDIS.</description>
<pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 13:07:00 +1100</pubDate>
<guid isPermaLink="false">\xmlcontent\201802\4805223.xml</guid>

<media:group>
<media:title>Vanita Connery and her daughter Olivia</media:title>
<media:description>Vanita Connery and her daughter Olivia</media:description>
<media:credit role="photographer">ABC News: Jade Macmillan</media:credit>

<item>
<title>Former bikie boss Mahmoud Hawi dies after being shot outside Sydney gym</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-15/bikie-boss-mahmoud-hawi-shooting-at-rockdale-gym/9450570</link>
<description>Former Comancheros chief Mahmoud Hawi, who rose to prominence for his role in a fatal 2009 brawl at Sydney Airport, dies after being shot at least six times outside a gym in Rockdale.</description>

<media:title>Comancheros leader Mahmoud 'Mick' Hawi</media:title>
<media:description>Comancheros leader Mahmoud 'Mick' Hawi</media:description>
<media:credit role="photographer">AAP: Paul Miller</media:credit>
<media:content url="http://www.abc.net.au/cm/lb/5723880/data/comancheros-leader-mahmoud-27mick27-hawi-data.jpg" type="image/jpg" width="876" height="1487" />

<item>
<title>Wallabies great and architect of first Rugby World Cup, Sir Nicholas Shehadie, dies</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-12/wallaby-great-sir-nicholas-shehadie-dies-in-sydney/9421732</link>
<description>One of the architects of the inaugural Rugby World Cup, Wallabies great Sir Nicholas Shehadie, dies in Sydney aged 91.</description>

<item>

<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-09/john-hemmes-son-edward-cameron-awarded-$1.75-million/9416654</link>

<item>
<title>Retro roller skating and why it's still going around (and around) after all these years</title>

<item>
<title>Teachers, paramedics eye crack in 'unfair, discriminatory' salary cap after Sydney train offer</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-08/train-deal-opens-floodgates-for-public-service-cap-removal/9407850</link>
<description>NSW public servants are seeing an opportunity to overturn the long-running pay-rise cap on salaries as the Government gives rail workers a better offer.</description>
<pubDate>Thu, 08 Feb 2018 14:37:00 +1100</pubDate>
<guid isPermaLink="false">\xmlcontent\201802\4800847.xml</guid>

<media:title>The Premier says the protesters can't match the message sent by voters at the state election.</media:title>
<media:description>Thousands of public sector workers gathered at the NSW Parliament on June 15, 2011, to protest again against legislation to cap public sector pay rises. The legislation passed the Upper House the previous day and was expected to pass the Lower House a few hours later. </media:description>

<media:group>
<media:title>Public sector unions have promised to continue fighting the pay cap.</media:title>
<media:description>A TV still of public sector workers protesting outside the NSW Parliament on June 2, 2011. They were voicing their anger over legislation to cap public sector pay rises at 2.5 per cent. Upper House MPs debated the bill until the early hours of the next morning as Labor and the Greens tried to delay it. But it was expected to pass in a special sitting on June 3 with the support of the Christian Democrats and Shooters and Fishers.</media:description>

<item>
<title>Under the Sydney Opera House is another unique structure   a 'doughnut-shaped' double helix car park</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-08/why-is-the-sydney-opera-house-car-park-spiral-in-shape/9270864</link>

<media:title>Why is the Sydney Opera House car park spiral in shape? Curious Sydney investigates.</media:title>
<media:description>Nestled beneath Sydney's Royal Botanical Gardens lies a unique double helix concrete car park, sinking 12 stories underground. Known as Bennelong Point Parking Station, the Sydney Opera House car park was built within a man-made sandstone cavern 42 metres into the earth.</media:description>

<media:title>Why is the Sydney Opera House car park spiral in shape? Curious Sydney investigates.</media:title>
<media:description>Nestled beneath Sydney's Royal Botanical Gardens lies a unique double helix concrete car park, sinking 12 stories underground. Known as Bennelong Point Parking Station, the Sydney Opera House car park was built within a man-made sandstone cavern 42 metres into the earth.</media:description>

<item>
<title>Climate change impact on Antarctica becomes clearer as scientists make progress with research</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-05/challenges-understanding-climate-change-impact-antarctica/9398192</link>
<description>Understanding exactly what is going on in Antarctica has long been fraught for climate scientists, but what is happening on the continent could soon be felt around the world.</description>

<item>

<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-05/hospital-death-paul-lau-inquest/9396744</link>
<description>When Paul Lau, a healthy 54-year-old, went into hospital for knee surgery, he died after being given pain medication meant for another patient. There were more than 15 opportunities for medical staff to pick up the mistake, an inquest has heard.</description>

<item>
<title>Sydney, Melbourne house prices have one-in-five chance of correction: JP Morgan</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-01-25/sydney-melbourne-housing-has-one-in-five-chance-of-correction/9360954</link>
<description>Sydney and Melbourne have a one-in-five chance of house prices falling at least 15 per cent over the next five years, according to economic modelling by investment bank JP Morgan.</description>
<pubDate>Thu, 25 Jan 2018 12:40:00 +1100</pubDate>
<guid isPermaLink="false">\xmlcontent\201801\4794294.xml</guid>
<category domain="http://www.abc.net.au/local/">ABC Radio Sydney</category>
<category domain="http://www.abc.net.au/abcregion/">sydney</category>
<category domain="http://www.abc.net.au/abcregion/">melbourne</category>
<category domain="http://www.abc.net.au/subjects/">Business, Economics and Finance:All:All</category>
<category domain="http://www.abc.net.au/subjects/">Business, Economics and Finance:Economic Trends:All</category>
<category domain="http://www.abc.net.au/subjects/">Business, Economics and Finance:Industry:Housing</category>
<category domain="http://www.abc.net.au/subjects/">Australia:All:All</category>

<media:title>Passengers trapped as train derails in Sydney's north-west</media:title>
<media:description>Three people are trapped after a train derailed in Sydney's north-west, and a number of others have been injured.

Emergency services are at the scene where the train failed to brake and hit a barrier at Richmond.</media:description>

<item>
<title>Death of woman found in Sydney unit block bins 'not suspicious'</title>
<link>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-01-18/nsw-police-say-nothing-suspicious-about-woman-found-dead-in-bin/9338428</link>
